newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak 45-wk T-bill average yield hits 19.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovak 45-wk T-bill average yield hits 19.4 pct.

text.p: Average yield in an auction of Slovak finance ministry 45-week treasury bills, the first of such a maturity this year,hit 19.404 percent, the central bank (NBS) said on Wednesady in statement.

Bids worth 440 million crowns ($12.6 million) were accepted out of total demand of 1.21 billion crowns, the NBS said. Minimum accepted yield was 18.50 percent while the maximum yield hit 20.00 percent.
Until Wednesday's auction, the longest T-bills this year were 26-weeks, sold on May 22 at an average yield of 14.25 percent.
Last week the Finance Ministry accepted an average yield of 17.80 percent in an auction of one-year state bonds.

The Finance Ministry on Wednesday also issued a 5.018 billion crown tranche of one-week treasury bills to the NBS portfolio. According to law the central bank can hold state securities of up to five percent of budget revenues of the previous fiscal year.
The ministry does not set the amount on offer in state securities auctions, nor does it set a minimum or maximum limit price on bids.
It uses T-bills and state bonds as the main tools to cover the state budget deficit, which widened to 17.790 billion crowns as of July 8.
